word_mean: 静脉：各器官各部位的血液流回心脏的管道。除肺静脉外，所有静脉运送低氧血。和动脉一样，静脉壁也分内、中、外三层，但不如动脉厚，切断后即萎陷。许多静脉均有内膜生成的瓣膜，防止血液倒流(另见vena条)

sentence.Network_en: It is one of his finest works in a lighter vein.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是他行文风格轻松活泼的作品中最出色的作品之一。

sentence.Network_en: This Spanish drama has a vein of black humour running through it.
sentence.Network_cn: 这出西班牙戏剧自始至终都带有几分黑色幽默。

sentence.Network_en: The director discovered a rich vein of sentimentality.
sentence.Network_cn: 导演发现了一个丰富的情感源泉。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French veine, from Latin vena. The earliest senses were 'blood vessel' and 'small natural underground channel of water'

entry.def: Your veins are the thin tubes in your body through which your blood flows towards your heart.

example.ex: Many veins are found just under the skin.
example.tran: 许多静脉血管就在皮肤下面。

entry.tran: （行文的）风格;（说话的）语气，情绪
entry.def: Something that is written or spoken in a particular vein is written or spoken in that style or mood.

example.ex: It is one  of his finest works in a lighter vein...
example.tran: 这是他行文风格轻松活泼的作品中最出色的作品之一。

example.ex: The girl now replies in similar vein.
example.tran: 这个女孩现在以相似的口吻回答。

entry.tran: 几分，若干（指在某人的行为或工作中常表现出的某种品质）
entry.def: A vein of a particular quality is evidence of that quality which someone often shows in their behaviour or work.

example.ex: The striker's  rich vein of form this season has seen him net 32 goals...
example.tran: 这位前锋本赛季状态奇佳，进球已达到32个。

example.ex: This Spanish drama has a vein of black humour running through it.
example.tran: 这出西班牙戏剧自始至终都带有几分黑色幽默。

entry.def: A vein of a particular metal or mineral is a layer of it lying in rock.

example.ex: ...a rich and deep vein of limestone.
example.tran: 储量丰富的深层石灰石矿脉

entry.def: The veins on a leaf are the thin lines on it.

example.ex: ...the serrated edges and veins of the feathery leaves.
example.tran: 羽状叶子的锯齿边沿和纹理

means.word_mean: 1. a blood vessel that carries blood from the capillaries toward the heart; all veins except the pulmonary carry unaerated blood

sentences.sentence: "he continued in this vein for several minutes"

means.word_mean: 3. any of the vascular bundles or ribs that form the branching framework of conducting and supporting tissues in a leaf or other plant organ
4. a layer of ore between layers of rock
5. one of the horny ribs that stiffen and support the wing of an insect

auth_sentence.content: The Major...swelling every already swollen vein in his head.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Major...swelling every already swollen vein in his head.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Major...swelling every already swollen vein in his head.

auth_sentence.content: Her left leg showed a livid ripple of varicose vein.
auth_sentence.res_content: Her left leg showed a livid ripple of varicose vein.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her left leg showed a livid ripple of varicose vein.

auth_sentence.content: Mr Tarkington writes in...a vein of waggish farce.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mr Tarkington writes in...a vein of waggish farce.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr Tarkington writes in...a vein of waggish farce.

jushi.english: I felt a pleasant glow in all my veins from the wine.
jushi.chinese: 喝过酒后我浑身的血都热烘烘的，感到很舒服。

jushi.english: She has pure gypsy blood in her veins.
jushi.chinese: 她血管里流的是纯吉卜赛人的血液。

jushi.english: Leaf veins distribute food and water throughout the leaf.
jushi.chinese: 叶脉把养料和水分分配给整张叶子。
